availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, farmer. Pulaski County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles Lee and Nancy Lee. Married to Anna Gilmore Lee in Pulaski County on January 16, 1826. Father of James Lee and Paulina Lee Cash. Farmer in Pulaski County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Pulaski County in 1850. Farmer in Pulaski County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Pulaski County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 1, p. 52A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 1, p. 208.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 1, p. 198B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053, Pulaski County Deaths.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pulaski County Marriages, Film 000804052.
